newsitem.title: USA: IBM introduces LogiCast broadcast package.
newsitem.headline: IBM introduces LogiCast broadcast package.

text.p: International Business Machines Corp said Monday it had introduced LogiCast, its package of digital broadcasting technologies and services for both video and data.

LogiCast allows viewers to enjoy much of digital television without having to buy a new digital TV and could serve as a transition product as the television industry moves to High Definition Television (HDTV), IBM said.

"The conversion of video from analog to digital formats is accelerating around the world, enabling new revenue-generating broadcast services through greater channel capacity, as well as improving video and audio quality," said William Beckmann, vice president of IBM Video Enabled Solutions.
"Our approach gives customers the flexibility to deliver their services to either TVs or personal computers," he said.
IBM, which made the announcement at the National Association of Broadcasters convention in Las Vegas, said LogiCast includes a video server as well as storage and networking products.
An industry team led by IBM already has installed an end-to-end digital broadcast solution in Italy for STET, the Italian telecommunications holding company.
The cable-based system has been serving customers of Stream, the multimedia group formed by STET to implement the new services, since last September, IBM said.
It said digital broadcasting allows for the transmission of up to 10 compressed digital programs on the same bandwidth taken up by one analog program.
